column5: ada-boy doc  you show HER who wears the pants ... for this week ....lol
Congratulations!!!
Way to go Doc   We wish you many years of happiness    Renting the camp was a great idea...I'll bet it was a lot of fun!
Congrats, hold on to that one she's a keeper
Congrats!  We'll save bugs bunny cliched line for the wedding night and/or honeymoon!
CONGRATS DOC!
Congrats again buddy! Great ceremony. Wished I could have stayed for saturday night, Im sure it was a good one.  See you for some splakin' in a couple of months
Congrats to you both.  Sounds like a great idea for your venue.
Congrads  LOL there is optimism for us ugly ducklings.  You got a beautiful wife.
I must be getting old, don't know how I missed this thread. Big congratulations, your wife is definitely a keeper.
But the big question is, can she cook fish?  Congratulations - pretty girl, and another victory for the whole concept of  "selective harvest."
How about yourself? Congrat's are in order no?
Congrats on the beautiful bride and the marrige.
Laura clipped me on the stringer a long time ago. It's only the weigh-in that was recent :-)
LOL  JUST DON'T SAY THIS TOO LOUD IN FRONT OF HER! AS OF YET I'VE GOT HER FOOLED!
Congratulations, i plunged in those waters in august, and im proud to say im having the time of my life. Here's wishing that you have the time of yours.  Andy
"My biggest fear is that when I die, my wife will sell all of my fishing gear for what I told her I paid for it".  Keep that in mind.  Congrats!
your conservation license allows you to keep a limit of 2
Congrats!! For sure a keeper So how long it took you to boat the fish?

I made the plunge this weekend, getting married at a lakeside ceremony on Saturday.  We rented a kids summer camp for an entire weekend allowing for our friends and family to come and stay for the entire weekend.  Much partying ensued.  Even troutologist made it home from the 'peg for it!  I don't have a whole lot of pics just yet, but here's my favourite...
Congrates.Nice pic,i am taking the plunge next october
Congradulations !!! to your wife for making an honest man out of you and the acquisition of half your fishing gear and Congratulations to you for such a beautiful catch
Congrats Doc  Nice Foto---Hope you have many happy years together  Bushart
Congrats bro
So wheres the report???.........uhhhhhh   that is water behind you isnt it?
i Heard about this a little while ago, didnt know when the day was....  Congrats Man  She looks great...you on the other hand...well......
Congrats Doc   Ditto on that!
Congrats!!!

Congratulations on your good fortune.  Now as a rep for the "Henpecked Husbands Union", Local 112, its time to impart the guys "secret" to a happy marriage.  Three simple rules to remember:  1)  Yes Dear  2)  No Dear  3)  Anytning you say Dear.  Remember them, use them. When practiced effectively you can either butter her up or drive her to frustration in under 30 seconds   It's all in how you say it
Yep.... definitely a KEEPER Congrats to both of you Leechman
A friend of mine did go out in search of lakers saturday morning but i'm pretty sure he was too hungover to wage any sort of assault on them...Here's a pic I took!
Wicked Dude!!! CONGRATS!!  Its MY TURN this SATURDAY, OCTOBER 3rd!!
WoW ....  A Real Beauty right there and Keeper for sure......      Congrats .....
Congrads !!!
congrats !!!
Nice way to spend a day, but what's that lure she's holdin'?  JF
Congrats, and congrats on not doing it on a long weekend or any openers. Would that have been at camp wakonda?  PS You 2 look familiar

Congratulations!  May I ask you where you went?  I'm kind of looking myself for a camp/big lodge or something for my upcoming wedding.  Will have friends/family from overseas, would love to have something on a lake for the weekend to get married. (And get in some partying and fishing as well...!)  Am looking for something preferably within three hours driving of Toronto...

I did it on the trout closer weekend which was mildly scandalous, but it was the only weekend available for the camp.  And yes, it was Camp Wakonda.  If we look familiar perhaps we live in your neighborhood?  We do walk a lot!
Camp Wakonda, 30 minutes east of Sault Ste. Marie. DEFINITELY not near the big smoke.
Congrats on the big day.....  hey... Brad Paisley has a fishing tournament that you have just been invited to http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8O3Plt8DyMk
LOL!  WE PLAYED THIS SONG AT THE RECEPTION! I also played "I'm Still A Guy" just to drive the message home!
I know that spot! ...   did you see any bass under the dock??
congrats. guess this wasn't a catch and release tourney.  I hope she likes fishing.
